metadata.title: CVE-2023-1074 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernel's Stream ControlTransmission Protocol. This issue may occur when a user starts a maliciousnetworking service and someone connects to this service. This could allow alocal user to starve resources, causing a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-lowlatency - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1154-aws - 4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-azure - 4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1148-gcp - 4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1117-oracle - 4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.170').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
